messages.title: VOTE FOR WHAT YOU BELIEVE IN

keyPolicies.policyDescription: End privatisation and bring railways and energy back into public hands.
End austerity, restore the public sector, and introduce a high minimum wage.
Massively reduce energy consumption and invest in renewable energy.
End student tuition fees, fund schools properly and introduce smaller class sizes.
Prevent climate change and adapt to its impact.

mentions.tacticalSituation: At the 2010 election, Bury St Edmunds was in the top ten Green results across the UK.

issues.economy: End austerity, restore the public sector, and introduce a high minimum wage.
issues.education: End student tuition fees, fund schools properly and introduce smaller class sizes.
issues.environment: Massively reduce energy consumption and invest in renewable energy. Prevent climate change and adapt to its impact.
issues.governance: End privatisation and bring railways and energy back into public hands.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm standing for Bury St Edmunds at the 2015 election. I've lived in the constituency since 2000, first in Bury and now in Woolpit, and my children are all at school in the constituency. My job as an archaeologist has shown me that society can change over time, and that we don't have to live in the way that we always have. It's up to us to make that change for the better - with courage and conviction we can build a better world.

images.caption: YOUR GREEN PARTY CANDIDATE HELEN GEAKE BURY ST EDMUNDS

leaflet.additionalNotes: This publication has not been paid for by big business or corporate interests, but has been supported and funded by ordinary people and printed using 100% post-consumer recycled paper. FSC (Forest Stewardship Council) recycled.
